lines.text: Sufferin' niblicks! A hole in one!
What's a birdie?
It's a thing that makes wise birds turn cuckoo.
Gee, Pa - lay off those heavy boxes! You're no Dempsey.
The boss has been hollerin' for you - an' he's mad as blazes.
Listen, Pa - if the old herring gets too fresh I'll quit - then where will he be?
The wealthy Widow Lomsdon had married in haste and repented at Reno.
Eustance Tewksbury was born in London and had been in a fog ever since.
How do I look?
You look like a million right from the mint!
Allie, I'm sorry - please let me explain! I can see you in there, Allie! Why don't you answer me? Won't oo let oo ittle boy friend make upsie wiv oo?
I'm going home, boss. You'll find me in the shipping room tomorrow morning. I'm not going to marry for money. I thought I was the whole maple forest, but I'm only the sap.
Whatever did I do with my nightgown?
Search me! Want me to turn on the light?
Don't you dare! I've found it!
Thank goodness!
How would you like to spend our honeymoon abroad?
Just dandy.
I'll turn on the light now, dear, if you are ready.
I'm ready.
